- Transport: Investing in new transport technologies, such as high-speed rail or autonomous vehicles, can be expensive and may come at the cost of other transportation priorities, such as improving public transportation systems or fixing existing infrastructure.

- Defence: Developing new military technologies, such as advanced weaponry or cybersecurity systems, can be costly and may divert resources away from other important defence priorities, such as personnel training or maintaining existing equipment.
